content.text: 801.1 Scope: Covers indirect waste piping and special wastes including air breaks, air gaps, and corrosive waste neutralization.
801.2 Protection: Special function equipment must be protected against backflow, fouling, flooding, and stoppage.
802.1 Where required: Includes food-handling equipment (non-dwelling), clear-water waste, humidifiers, dishwashing equipment.
802.1.1 Food handling: Must discharge via air gap; each sink well discharges independently.
802.1.2 Floor drains in food storage: Must be indirectly connected by air gap or air break; exceptions apply for backflow protection.
802.1.3 Potable clear-water waste: Must discharge through indirect waste with air gap.
802.1.4 Swimming pools: Backwash and deck drains must discharge via air gap.
802.1.5 Nonpotable clear-water waste: Must discharge through air gap or air break.
802.1.6 Commercial dishwashers: Require air gap or air break per Section 802.3.
802.1.7 Food sinks: Non-residential food-related sinks must discharge indirectly with air gap or air break.
802.2 Materials and joints: Must comply with Chapter 7 for installation and materials.
802.3 Installation: Air gap or air break into trapped and vented waste receptors. Traps required for indirect lines >30" horiz. or >54" total length.
802.3.1 Air gap: At least 2× effective opening of waste pipe above flood rim.
802.3.2 Air break: Provided between pipe and trap seal.
802.4 Waste receptors: Must be accessible, not concealed. No installation in plenums, attics, crawl spaces, etc.
802.4.1 Sizing: Must accommodate maximum indirect discharge.
802.4.2 Hub drains: Pipe hub must extend ≥1" above floor.
802.4.3 Standpipes: Trapped individually, 18"–42" above trap weir with access for rodding.
802.4.3.1 Laundry tray alternative: May connect via standpipe; must meet spacing and height requirements.
803.1 Neutralization: Corrosive or harmful liquids must be treated before entering drainage system using automatic neutralizing devices.
803.2 System Design: Chemical drainage systems must be separate from sanitary and approved prior to install.
